verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, saying ,
Thus speaketh the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , saying , Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.

For, lo, the days come , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers , and they shall possess it. \p
¶ And these \add are\add* the words that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; We have heard a voice of trembling , of fear , and not of peace.\f + \fr 30.5 \ft of fear…: or, there is fear, and not peace\f*

Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child ? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins , as a woman in travail , and all faces are turned into paleness ?\f + \fr 30.6 \ft a man: Heb. a male\f*
Alas ! for that day \add is\add* great , so that none \add is\add* like it: it \add is\add* even the time of Jacob’s trouble ; but he shall be saved out of it.

For it shall come to pass in that day , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , \add that\add* I will break his yoke from off thy neck , and will burst thy bonds , and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:
But they shall serve the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* their God , and David their king , whom I will raise up unto them. \p

¶ Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; neither be dismayed , O Israel : for, lo, I will save thee from afar , and thy seed from the land of their captivity ; and Jacob shall return , and shall be in rest , and be quiet , and none shall make \add him\add* afraid.

For I \add am\add* with thee, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, to save thee: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, yet will I not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure , and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.
For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Thy bruise \add is\add* incurable , \add and\add* thy wound \add is\add* grievous.
\add There is\add* none to plead thy cause , that thou mayest be bound up : thou hast no healing medicines.\f + \fr 30.13 \ft that…: Heb. for binding up, or, pressing\f*

All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy , with the chastisement of a cruel one , for the multitude of thine iniquity ; \add because\add* thy sins were increased.
Why criest thou for thine affliction ? thy sorrow \add is\add* incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity : \add because\add* thy sins were increased , I have done these things unto thee.

Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured ; and all thine adversaries , every one of them, shall go into captivity ; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil , and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.

For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; because they called thee an Outcast , \add saying\add*, This \add is\add* Zion , whom no man seeketh after. \p

¶ Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Behold, I will bring again the captivity of Jacob’s tents , and have mercy on his dwellingplaces ; and the city shall be builded upon her own heap , and the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.\f + \fr 30.18 \ft heap: or, little hill\f*
And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry : and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few ; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
Their children also shall be as aforetime , and their congregation shall be established before me, and I will punish all that oppress them.

And their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near , and he shall approach unto me: for who \add is\add* this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And ye shall be my people , and I will be your God.

Behold, the whirlwind of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* goeth forth with fury , a continuing whirlwind : it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.\f + \fr 30.23 \ft continuing: Heb. cutting\f*\f + \fr 30.23 \ft fall…: or, remain\f*

The fierce anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall not return , until he have done \add it\add*, and until he have performed the intents of his heart : in the latter days ye shall consider it.
